quiz.quiz_name: Combined (Python, SQL and ML) Coding Exam
quiz.test_name: Combined (Python, SQL and ML) Coding Exam
quiz.parent_instruction:
General Directions

1. This test consists of 10 Subjective questions .

2. Write the detailed code including importing of necessary library wherever required

3. Each question in the test carry 5 marks each (Except 3  questions -10 marks each).

4. Read each question and write the code carefully.

5. All Questions are mandatory.

6. For any Question , If you feel that you need a data-set , Create a virtual data-set by yourself & do the needful.

7. Be sure to allocate your time carefully (45 mins) so you are able to complete the entire test within the testing session.

8. You may go back and review your answers at any time during the testing session.

9. You may NOT use a calculator or reference materials during the testing session.

[{"input_type":5,"question_string":"

Abstract: Hourly Minneapolis-St Paul, MN traffic volume for westbound I-94. Includes weather and holiday features from 2012-2018.\r<\/p>

Data Set Information:\r<\/p>

Hourly Interstate 94 Westbound traffic volume for MN DoT ATR station 301, roughly midway between Minneapolis and St Paul, MN. Hourly weather features and holidays included for impacts on traffic volume.\r<\/p>

Attribute Information:\r<\/p>

holiday Categorical US National holidays plus regional holiday, Minnesota State Fair\r<\/p>

temp Numeric Average temp in kelvin\r<\/p>

rain_1h Numeric Amount in mm of rain that occurred in the hour\r<\/p>

snow_1h Numeric Amount in mm of snow that occurred in the hour\r<\/p>

clouds_all Numeric Percentage of cloud cover\r<\/p>

weather_main Categorical Short textual description of the current weather\r<\/p>

weather_description Categorical Longer textual description of the current weather\r<\/p>

date_time DateTime Hour of the data collected in local CST time\r<\/p>

 traffic_volume Numeric Hourly I-94 ATR 301 reported westbound traffic volume<\/p>

<\/p>

\r<\/p>

Write the machine learning code for the following dataset . Take care for underfitting,overfitting .Use Gridsearchcv to find the best parameter. Check the metrics .\r<\/p>


<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>\n","options":[[]],"marks":10,"neg_mark":0,"hint":"","opposite_marking":0}]

[{"input_type":5,"question_string":"

For the next two questions: A regression between foot length (response variable in cm) and height (explanatory variable in inches) for 34 students resulted in the following regression equation:\r<\/p>

yˆ = 10.9 + 0.23 x\r<\/p>

a). One student in the sample was 76 inches tall with a foot length of 30 cm. What is the predicted foot length for this student?\r<\/p>

b). One student in the sample was 76 inches tall with a foot length of 30 cm. What is the residual error for this student?<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>

\r<\/p>\n","options":[[]],"marks":5,"neg_mark":0,"hint":"","opposite_marking":0}]
